qas.question: When did Ralph Roberts get into the cable TV business?
Who were Roberts' business partners in this purchase?

answers.text: Daniel Aaron and Julian A. Brodsky

qas.question: What company did this partnership purchase?
What city did American Cable Systems do business in?
How many customers did ACS have when Roberts and his partners purchased it?

plausible_answers.text: Daniel Aaron and Julian A. Brodsky

qas.question: Which two partners owned Jerrold Electronics?
How many customers did Storecast Corporation of America have in 1963?
What did Ralph J. Roberts sell in 1963?
American Cable Systems was the parent company of what spin-off?

context: In <a0_0>1963<a0_0/>, Ralph J. Roberts in conjunction with his two business partners, <a1_0><b6_0>Daniel Aaron and Julian A. Brodsky<b6_0/><a1_0/>, purchased <a2_0><b8_0>American Cable Systems<b8_0/><a2_0/> as a corporate spin-off from its parent, <b9_0>Jerrold Electronics<b9_0/>, for <b5_0>US $500,000<b5_0/>. At the time, American Cable was a small cable operator in <a3_0>Tupelo, Mississippi<a3_0/>, with five channels and <a4_0><b7_0>12,000<b7_0/><a4_0/> customers. Storecast Corporation of America, a product placement supermarket specialist marketing firm, was purchased by American Cable in 1965. With Storecast being a Muzak client, American Cable purchased its first Muzak franchise of many in Orlando, Florida.
